context.title: Clip Horizon
context.description: Clip Horizon limits time or depth values in a horizon replacing them with nulls or setting them to the specified minimum and maximum range.

context.title: Erase Area
context.description: Erase Area sets all values within an area of interest to null.

context.title: Group Multiples
context.description: Group Multiples computes a set of predefined multiples from depth or time input horizons.

context.title: Median Smooth
context.description: Median Smooth uses a median filter to smooth a horizon. A median filter is a non-linear filtering technique that preserves steps in maps.

context.title: Decimate Horizon
context.description: Decimate extracts points from a grid. Grid geometry is not changed.

context.title: Linear Interpolation
context.description: Linear Interpolation removes null values in a horizon by performing linear interpolation on nearby values. Linear Interpolation does not extend the horizon to the limits of its box; only interior nulls are interpolated.

context.title: Horizon Merge
context.description: Horizon Merge will merge several horizons with the same geometry using Minimum, Maximum, or OR operations.

context.title: Extract Area
context.description: Extract Area sets all values outside a specified area of interest to null.

context.title: Velocity Model Checker
context.description: Velocity Model Checker will QC top and base salt horizons before using them in velocity flood.

context.title: Convert Horizon
context.description: Convert Horizon changes the origin and grid spacing of an existing horizon and create a new horizon. This algorithm only modifies the grid on which a horizon is displayed; it does not modify the horizon itself.

context.title: Extrapolate
context.description: Extrapolate extends an existing horizon by creating new data points within the grid using nearby values. Extrapolation is similar to interpolation, but the results are often less meaningful, and are more uncertain.

context.title: Grid Lines
context.description: GridLines extracts lines from a grid. Grid geometry is not changed.

context.title: Weighted Smooth
context.description: Weighted Smooth will smooth an input horizon using an optional second horizon as a mask.

context.title: Interpolate Tessellate
context.description: Interpolate Tessellate uses triangular tessellation to fill null values in a horizon.

context.title: Kuwahara Filter Algorithm
context.description: Kuwahara median filters preserve steps and isolate anomalies in an attribute.

context.title: Symmetric Nearest Neighbor Algorithm
context.description: Symmetric Nearest Neighbor (SNN) smoothes by comparing corresponding pixels across a kernel, selecting values that are closest to the center pixel value, and then averaging.

context.title: Convolution (Linear Filters) Algorithm
context.description: The Convolution (Linear Filters) algorithm smooths horizons with a Gaussian, Square Mean, or Circular Mean filter. The Convolution algorithm passes horizon data through a linear filter to reduce noise in the seismic image.
